## 🎨 Visual Exploration

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(readxl)
df <- read_excel("quantum_sales_data.xlsx")
ggplot(df, aes(x=Quarter, y=Revenue, fill=Product)) +
  geom_bar(stat="identity", position="dodge") +
  theme_minimal()
```

## 🧠 Reflect

> What trends do you notice across quarters?
> What could explain the variance?

## 🐍 Python Alternative

```{python}
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_excel("quantum_sales_data.xlsx")
sns.barplot(data=df, x="Quarter", y="Revenue", hue="Product")
plt.title("Revenue by Quarter and Product")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()
```
